intro: Crambe microcarpa, commonly known as the dwarf crambe, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant has alternate, pinnately compound leaves that are often hairy and covered in fine pubescence. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, containing oil-rich seeds that have been used for industrial purposes. Crambe microcarpa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
